item.text: The Lord spoke to Jeremiah in the fourth year that Jehoiakim son of Josiah was ruling over Judah:

“<st data-num="03947" class="">Get</st> a <st data-num="04039 05612">scroll</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03789" class="">Write</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">on</st> it <st data-num="03605 01697 0834">everything</st> I have <st data-num="01696 0413">told</st> you to say<n id="2" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">about</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>, and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the other <st data-num="01471" class="">nations</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">since</st> I began to <st data-num="01696" class="">speak</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> you in the <st data-num="03117" class="">reign</st> of <st data-num="02977" class="">Josiah</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="03117 02088">now</st>.<n id="3" />

Perhaps when the people of Judah hear about all the disaster I intend to bring on them, they will all stop doing the evil things they have been doing. If they do, I will forgive their sins and the wicked things they have done.”
So Jeremiah summoned Baruch son of Neriah. Then, Baruch wrote down in a scroll all the Lord’s words that he had told to Jeremiah as they came from his mouth.
Then Jeremiah told Baruch, “I am no longer allowed to go into the Lord’s temple.

So you go there the next time all the people of Judah come in from their towns to fast in the Lord’s temple. Read out loud where all of them can hear you what I told you the Lord said, which you wrote in the scroll.
Perhaps then they will ask the Lord for mercy and will all stop doing the evil things they have been doing. For the Lord has threatened to bring great anger and wrath against these people.”
So Baruch son of Neriah did exactly what the prophet Jeremiah told him to do. He read what the Lord had said from the scroll in the temple of the Lord.

All the people living in Jerusalem and all the people who came into Jerusalem from the towns of Judah observed a fast before the Lord. The fast took place in the ninth month of the fifth year that Jehoiakim son of Josiah was ruling over Judah.

At that time Baruch went into the temple of the Lord. He stood in the entrance of the room of Gemariah the son of Shaphan who had been the royal secretary. That room was in the upper court near the entrance of the New Gate. There, where all the people could hear him, he read from the scroll what Jeremiah had said.
Micaiah, who was the son of Gemariah and the grandson of Shaphan, heard Baruch read from the scroll everything the Lord had said.

He <st data-num="03381" class="">went down</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="03957" class="">chamber</st> of the royal <st data-num="05608" class="">secretary</st> in the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">palace</st> and <st data-num="02009" class="">found</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the court <st data-num="08269" class="">officials</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">in session</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>. <st data-num="0476" class="">Elishama</st><n id="1" /> the royal <st data-num="05608" class="">secretary</st>, <st data-num="01806" class="">Delaiah</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="08098" class="">Shemaiah</st>, <st data-num="0494" class="">Elnathan</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="05907" class="">Achbor</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="01587" class="">Gemariah</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="08227" class="">Shaphan</st>, <st data-num="06667" class="">Zedekiah</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="02608" class="">Hananiah</st>, and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the other <st data-num="08269" class="">officials</st> were seated there.

<st data-num="04321" class="">Micaiah</st> <st data-num="05046" class="">told</st> them <st data-num="03605 01697 0834">everything</st> he had <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> <st data-num="01263" class="">Baruch</st> <st data-num="07121" class="">read</st> from the <st data-num="05612" class="">scroll</st> in the <st data-num="0241" class="">hearing</st> of the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> the <st data-num="08269" class="">officials</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="03065" class="">Jehudi</st>, who was the <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="05418" class="">Nethaniah</st>, the <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="08018" class="">Shelemiah</st>, the <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="03570" class="">Cushi</st>, <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01263" class="">Baruch</st>. They ordered him to <st data-num="0559" class="">tell</st> Baruch, “<st data-num="01980" class="">Come</st> here and <st data-num="03947" class="">bring</st> with <st data-num="03027" class="">you</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="04039 0834">scroll</st> you <st data-num="07121" class="">read</st> in the <st data-num="0241" class="">hearing</st> of the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>.”<n id="2" /> So <st data-num="01263" class="">Baruch</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="05374" class="">Neriah</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">went</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> them, <st data-num="03947" class="">carrying</st> the <st data-num="04039" class="">scroll</st> in his <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st>.<n id="3" />

They <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him, “<st data-num="04994" class="">Please</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">sit down</st> and <st data-num="07121" class="">read</st> it to <st data-num="0241" class="">us</st>.” So <st data-num="01263" class="">Baruch</st> sat down and <st data-num="07121" class="">read</st> it to <st data-num="0241" class="">them</st>.<n id="1" />

When they had <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">it</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st>,<n id="1" /> they <st data-num="06342" class="">expressed</st> their <st data-num="06342" class="">alarm</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">one</st> <st data-num="07453" class="">another</st>.<n id="2" /> Then they <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01263" class="">Baruch</st>, “We must <st data-num="05046" class="">certainly</st> <st data-num="05046" class="">give</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="05046" class="">a report</st> about <st data-num="03605 01697">everything</st> you <st data-num="0428" class="">have read</st>!”<n id="3" />

Then they <st data-num="07592 0559">asked</st> <st data-num="01263" class="">Baruch</st>, “<st data-num="05046 04994 0349">How</st> did you come to <st data-num="03789" class="">write</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">words</st>? Do they actually come from Jeremiah’s <st data-num="06310" class="">mouth</st>?”<n id="1" />

<st data-num="01263" class="">Baruch</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">answered</st>, “Yes, they came from his own <st data-num="06310" class="">mouth</st>. He <st data-num="07121" class="">dictated</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">words</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me, and <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> <st data-num="03789" class="">wrote</st> them <st data-num="03789" class="">down</st> in <st data-num="01773" class="">ink</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> this <st data-num="05612" class="">scroll</st>.”<n id="1" />
Then the officials said to Baruch, “You and Jeremiah must go and hide. You must not let anyone know where you are.”
The officials put the scroll in the room of Elishama, the royal secretary, for safekeeping. Then they went to the court and reported everything to the king.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="03065" class="">Jehudi</st> to <st data-num="03947" class="">get</st> the <st data-num="04039" class="">scroll</st>. He went and <st data-num="03947" class="">got</st> it from the <st data-num="03957" class="">room</st> of <st data-num="0476" class="">Elishama</st>, the royal <st data-num="05608" class="">secretary</st>. Then <st data-num="03065" class="">he</st> himself<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07121" class="">read</st> it <st data-num="0241" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="08269" class="">officials</st> who were <st data-num="05975" class="">standing</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">around</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">him</st>.

Since it was the <st data-num="08671" class="">ninth</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st> of the year, the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> was <st data-num="03427" class="">sitting</st> in his <st data-num="02779" class="">winter</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">quarters</st>.<n id="1" /> A <st data-num="0784">fire</st> was <st data-num="01197" class="">burning</st> in the <st data-num="0254" class="">firepot</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">in front of</st> him.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="01961" class="">As soon</st> as <st data-num="03065" class="">Jehudi</st> had <st data-num="07121" class="">read</st> <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> or <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> <st data-num="01817" class="">columns</st><n id="1" /> of the scroll, the king<n id="2" /> would <st data-num="07167" class="">cut</st> them <st data-num="07167" class="">off</st> with a <st data-num="08593 05608">penknife</st><n id="3" /> and <st data-num="07993" class="">throw</st> them <st data-num="0413" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st> <st data-num="0834 0413">in</st> the <st data-num="0254" class="">firepot</st>. He kept doing so <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> the <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="04039" class="">scroll</st> was <st data-num="08552" class="">burned up</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="0784 0834 05921 0254">fire</st>.<n id="4" />

<st data-num="03808" class="">Neither</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">he</st> nor <st data-num="03605" class="">any</st> of his <st data-num="05650" class="">attendants</st> <st data-num="06342" class="">showed</st> any <st data-num="06342" class="">alarm</st> when they <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0428 01697">that had been read</st>. <st data-num="03808" class="">Nor</st> did they <st data-num="07167" class="">tear</st> their <st data-num="0899" class="">clothes</st> to show any grief or sorrow.<n id="1" />

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">even</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">listen</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="0494" class="">Elnathan</st>, <st data-num="01806" class="">Delaiah</st>, and <st data-num="01587" class="">Gemariah</st>, who had <st data-num="06293" class="">urged</st> him <st data-num="01115" class="">not</st> to <st data-num="08313" class="">burn</st> the <st data-num="04039" class="">scroll</st>.<n id="1" />
He also ordered Jerahmeel, who was one of the royal princes, Seraiah son of Azriel, and Shelemiah son of Abdeel to arrest the scribe Baruch and the prophet Jeremiah. However, the Lord hid them.
The Lord’s message came to Jeremiah after the king had burned the scroll with the words Baruch had written down at Jeremiah’s dictation.

“<st data-num="07725 03947">Get</st> <st data-num="0312" class="">another</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="04039" class="">scroll</st> and <st data-num="03789" class="">write</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> it <st data-num="03605 01697 07223">everything</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> written <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="07223" class="">original</st> <st data-num="04039" class="">scroll</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="03079" class="">Jehoiakim</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> <st data-num="08313" class="">burned</st>.

Tell King Jehoiakim of Judah, ‘The Lord says, “You burned the scroll. You asked Jeremiah, ‘How dare you write in this scroll that the king of Babylon will certainly come and destroy this land and wipe out all the people and animals on it?’”
So the Lord says concerning King Jehoiakim of Judah, “None of his line will occupy the throne of David. His dead body will be thrown out to be exposed to scorching heat by day and frost by night.

I will <st data-num="06485 05921">punish</st> him and his <st data-num="02233" class="">descendants</st> and the <st data-num="05650" class="">officials who serve</st> him for the <st data-num="05771" class="">wicked things</st> they have done.<n id="1" /> I will <st data-num="0935" class="">bring</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> them, the <st data-num="03427" class="">citizens</st> of <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> and the <st data-num="0376" class="">people</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah,</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="07451" class="">disaster</st> <st data-num="0834">that</st> I <st data-num="01696" class="">told</st> them about and that they <st data-num="03808 08085">ignored</st>.”’”<n id="2" />

Then Jeremiah got another scroll and gave it to the scribe Baruch son of Neriah. As Jeremiah dictated, Baruch wrote on this scroll everything that had been on the scroll that King Jehoiakim of Judah burned in the fire. They also added on this scroll several other messages of the same kind.
